text.english: Teorema: \(\texttt{add}\) is correct (\(\texttt{add}\) of two \(\mathcal{N}Term\) is equivalent to the sum of the correspondent numberical values of the two \(\mathcal{N}Term)), i.e. \[ \forall n,m \in \mathcal{N}Term . \; \texttt{val}(\texttt{add}(n,m)) = \texttt{val}(n) + \texttt{val}(m) \]
text.italiano: Teorema: \(\texttt{add}\) Ã¨ corretta (\(\texttt{add}\) di due \(\mathcal{N}Term\) equivale alla somma dei corrispondenti valori numerici dei due \(\mathcal{N}Term)), i.e. \[ \forall n,m \in \mathcal{N}Term . \; \texttt{val}(\texttt{add}(n,m)) = \texttt{val}(n) + \texttt{val}(m) \]

theorem.coq: Theorem val_add: forall n m : nterm , val (add n m) = val n + val m.
